sense.name: squeeze tightly between or as if between the fingers
sense.examples: Edmund pinched the bridge of his nose. Before speaking he pinched the raven, which squawked angrily. The doctors thought for the longest time that I had just pinched the nerve. During the body work, that repair man had pinched the line. Our parents could really pinch a penny.

sense.name: constrict or exert pressure on
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[topic] PINCH NP2 Note: compare to Sense 1 where NP1 is [agent]
sense.examples: These shoes pinch my feet. Demographic trends will pinch government budgets. The strike has pinched spending in Topeka. The embargo pinches at the very heart of this country's economy.

sense.name: steal
sense.examples: Who pinched the toilet paper? I think he pinched that hat from the wardrobe department.

sense.name: prune
sense.examples: You should pinch the plants back to create more branching and more flowers. But the asters are newer to me, and I've been wondering if I should pinch.
